New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their undefeated streak to 15 games, joining an elite group of teams in NBA history.
Darius Garland led with 25 points, 12 assists, and five rebounds.
Evan Mobley contributed with 23 points, 11 assists, and a key block of Brandon Miller’s dunk attempt.
Key Match Events: Mobley’s crucial block with two minutes remaining.
Cleveland scored 72 points in the first half and maintained the lead throughout the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers have the league’s highest offensive rating and are performing well defensively.
They are using a faster, more dynamic offensive approach compared to last season.
Post-Match Reflections: The win improved the Cavaliers to 8-0 at home and 15-0 overall, a franchise record.
Donovan Mitchell, who rested, scored a season-high 37 points in a previous game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have a strong home performance and are preparing for a tough upcoming game against the Boston Celtics.
They are creating wide-open looks with their offensive style and have a high three-point shooting percentage.
Others: The Cavaliers have four players scoring at least 20 points in their last two games.
Kenny Atkinson has the second-highest wins to start a career with a new team.
